intro: Amauropelta tamandarei, commonly known as the Tamandare fern, is a rare and unique species native to the tropical rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are divided into small, linear segments. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with a short, creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on fern evolution and biodiversity in neotropical ecosystems.
